description:
This course provides students with a survey of British poetry and poetics from the Restoration to the Modern period, and usually will include writers ranging from Aphra Behn and Alexander Pople to Thomas Hardy. The course may be offered in various froms, some covering less, and some more historical ground. Most will provide a sampling of eighteenth-century, Romantic, and Victorial poets. 

See the English Department's website at www.english.upenn.edu for a description of the current offerings.
name: BRITISH POETRY 1660-1914: ROMANTICS TO MODERNS
